tag_to_content.title: Loud Capital
tag_to_content.p_0: LOUD Capital is changing alternative investments by leveraging the power of capital to improve lives and solve the worldâs biggest problems.
tag_to_content.p_1: To solve the worldâs biggest problems, youâve got to be LOUD. We turn up the volume post-investment, breaking down obstacles with accumulated experience, collaboration and an unwavering drive to find solutions.
tag_to_content.p_2: Being LOUD signifies the capacity to amplify and actualize both profit and purpose, resulting in massive value.
tag_to_content.h2_0: Putting people at the center of investing.
tag_to_content.p_3: We offer Limited Partners a variety of alternative investment opportunities to diversify their wealth management strategy.
tag_to_content.p_4: We provide a platform of resources for investors, entrepreneurs, and emerging managers to grow scalable, profitable companies.
tag_to_content.p_5: Our team is diverse in background and industry experience. Â The result? Unique insights, perspectives and opportunities.
tag_to_content.h2_1: Ready to take the next step?
tag_to_content.p_6: Whether you're interested in pitching, investing, LOUD X or even asking a general question - fill out this form to get started.

tag_to_content.title: Privacy Policy - Loud Capital
tag_to_content.p_0: Your privacy is important to us. It is LOUD Capitals' policy to respect your privacy regarding any information we may collect from you across our website, www.loud.vc, and other sites we own and operate.
tag_to_content.p_1: We only ask for personal information when we truly need it to provide a service to you. We collect it by fair and lawful means, with your knowledge and consent. We also let you know why weâre collecting it and how it will be used.
tag_to_content.p_2: We only retain collected information for as long as necessary to provide you with your requested service. What data we store, weâll protect within commercially acceptable means to prevent loss and theft, as well as unauthorized access, disclosure, copying, use, or modification.
tag_to_content.p_3: We donât share any personally identifying information publicly or with third-parties, except when required to by law.
tag_to_content.p_4: Our website may link to external sites that are not operated by us. Please be aware that we have no control over the content and practices of these sites, and cannot accept responsibility or liability for their respective privacy policies.
tag_to_content.p_5: You are free to refuse our request for your personal information, with the understanding that we may be unable to provide you with some of your desired services.Your continued use of our website will be regarded as acceptance of our practices around privacy and personal information. If you have any questions about how we handle user data and personal information, feel free to contact us via email athello@loud.vc.
tag_to_content.p_6: This policy is effective as of November 30, 2023.

tag_to_content.title: Services â Loud Capital
tag_to_content.h1_0: It takes more than capital to build massive value.
tag_to_content.div_3: LOUD offers a platform of strategy, guidance, and resources for investors, entrepreneurs, and emerging managers to grow scalable, impactful, profitable companies. Explore all our services below.
tag_to_content.p_0: LoudX was born out of the experience of entrepreneurs and venture capitalists to help high growth companies collaborate to solve the biggest problems holding them back.
tag_to_content.p_1: LoudX facilitates workshops that guide teams to drive action, accountability and alignment to achieve healthy growth.
tag_to_content.p_2: Enhance your Wealth Management firm's capabilities with LOUD Capital's Alternative Asset Partnership Service. Designed for firms lacking internal alternative asset management teams, our service enables easy access to professionally managed venture capital, private equity, SBE Financing, and more. Utilize our experience and network to elevate your offerings and provide clients with diversified investment opportunities.
tag_to_content.p_3: Our asset allocation models are managed by experienced CFA Charter holders, Ph.D. economists, and we use cutting-edge technologies to deliver services and performance levels reserved for the ultra-wealthy at a low cost.

tag_to_content.title: Portfolio â Loud Capital
tag_to_content.p_0: Take a deeper dive into our diverse portfolio of over 100 companies. Here are a select few highlights.
tag_to_content.p_1: Genetesis is leveraging data science and biomagnetism in the fight against cardiovascular disease.
tag_to_content.p_2: Share Mobility partners with corporations to provide access to safe, reliable, on time transportation for their workforces.
tag_to_content.p_3: OFFOR Health is an on-site care delivery platform that utilizes existing capacity medical offices to accelerate surgery backlogs.
tag_to_content.p_4: Hyperion Motors, Inc. is a green technology company focused on hydrogen-based power and delivery.
tag_to_content.p_5: LiveEasy is the country's first full-service home management concierge platform.
tag_to_content.p_6: Carely is a free caregiving app to keep families connected and organized around the care of a loved one.
tag_to_content.p_7: Raydiant Oximetry creates medical devices focused on improving outcomes for mothers and babies during childbirth.
tag_to_content.p_8: 10XTS specializes in providing universal governance, risk, and compliance solutions for controllable electronic records.
tag_to_content.p_9: Honest Game is an automated system that empowers school staff and their families to unlock college athletic opportunities.
tag_to_content.p_10: Pay Theory is a payments platform for education, healthcare, childcare and children's activities service providers.
tag_to_content.p_11: Medzoomer is an on demand prescription delivery service platform that provides safe and secure medication drop-off.
tag_to_content.p_12: SupplyHive helps organizations hold suppliers accountable and deliver enhanced partnerships.
tag_to_content.p_13: Revibe Technologies is a digital therapeutics company fusing behavioral science with technology.
tag_to_content.p_14: Knowwake is the leading water navigation platform providing GPS services and in-app advertising for vessels.
tag_to_content.p_15: Gemelli Biotech leverages leading biological discoveries related to the microbiome to provide non-invasive precision diagnostics.
tag_to_content.p_16: GiftHealth streamlines the pharmacy experience with free delivery and competitive medication pricing.
tag_to_content.p_17: Carallel provides the digital tools and human support to caregivers to alleviate burden and improve patient care.
tag_to_content.p_18: Beyond Physician provides resources that empower healthcare professionals to learn, earn, grow, and network.

tag_to_content.title: Invest â Loud Capital
tag_to_content.p_0: Balancing a mix of traditional and alternative investments leads to risk reduction, enhanced return potential, lower portfolio volatility and smoother, more consistent growth over time.
tag_to_content.p_1: The key to successful healthcare ventures? Stakeholders who understand its complexities. Â We know, because weâve been there - as founders of healthcare companies, clinicians, and patients.
tag_to_content.p_2: Thatâs why weâve created a comprehensive platform of resources to empower teams, enable rapid growth and ensure longevity for our portfolio companies. The result? Massive value, improved solutions for communities and mitigated risk for our investors.
tag_to_content.h5_4: Fueling innovations that drive equitable access to high-quality, inclusive healthcare.
tag_to_content.p_3: We invest in people-centered healthcare - including medtech, alternative care models, and healthcare infrastructure and IT.LOUD Catalyst Strategic Advisors
tag_to_content.h5_6: Take a look at select LOUD Portfolio Companies
tag_to_content.p_4: Dividend Growth is a multi-prong offering, combining our speciality finance lending strategy with Life Settlements, the purchase of insurance policies, which is a non-correlated asset class. Similar to a mutual fund, this alternative investment option enables investors access to several alternative asset classes in one investment, providing diversification, steady quarterly returns, and policy asset protection.
tag_to_content.p_5: Private Growth provides our investors exposure to the private credit lending alternatives. This is our passive income offering that allows investors to commit capital for shorter terms ranging from 1, 2, and 3 years with returns paid out quarterly. Our strategy is to lend to stable cash-flowing small-medium businesses across the US and provide short-term revenue-based asset financing. Revenue-Based Financing provides critical working capital to small and medium size businesses that are underserved by traditional institutional banks.

tag_to_content.title: About â Loud Capital
tag_to_content.h1_0: Being just an investor isnât enough.
tag_to_content.p_0: When you work with LOUD, youâre not just working with passionate investors. Youâre working with a team of experienced entrepreneurs, operators, physicians, parents, patientsâand most importantly, human beings.
tag_to_content.p_1: We ask smart questions while we explore all options and ideas openly.
tag_to_content.p_2: We put people first and aim to find shared experiences to connect on.
tag_to_content.p_3: We tell stories, educate, and embrace our diverse perspectives.
tag_to_content.p_4: Our team is diverse in background and industry experience. The result? Unique insights, perspectives and opportunities.
tag_to_content.p_6: At LOUD Capital, Navin leverages his experience as a physician to keep people at the center of problem-solving, as a founder to be creative and patiently stubborn to get things across the finish line, and as an investor to understand the journey is long and will require different skill sets along the way. He has founded 3 companies and has raised capital for multiple companies and funds. He is focused on healthcare in the venture space and has helped shape LOUD to be an alternative investment firm that combines profit with purpose.
tag_to_content.div_10: Managing Partner & Lead of Alternative Passive Income
tag_to_content.div_11: Managing Partner & Lead of Alternative Passive Income
tag_to_content.p_8: With over two decades of executive experience in operational and international business development, Nishad brings a wealth of knowledge to the alternative investment landscape. Throughout his career, he has spearheaded large global commercial growth teams at publicly traded companies, ranging in size from $3 to $23 billion. Nishad has a proven track record of successfully launching and mentoring businesses in e-commerce, real estate, and private business lending.
tag_to_content.p_9: As a key figure at LOUD, Nishad channels his passion into creating distinctive funds that afford investors flexibility in capital with a focus on time horizon and risk management. In his role, he oversees the specialty finance, private credit, and life settlement arm, which is dedicated to funding small and medium-sized businesses across diverse industries.
tag_to_content.p_10: In addition to his financial acumen, Nishad is an accomplished Tabla player (Indian percussion), reflecting his dedication to cultivating creativity beyond the boardroom. A graduate of Michigan State University with a bachelor's degree in Electrical & Computer Engineering, Nishad further honed his skills with an MBA from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University.
tag_to_content.div_13: Managing Partner & Lead Partner Catalyst Health Fund
tag_to_content.div_14: Managing Partner & Lead Partner Catalyst Health Fund
tag_to_content.p_12: At LOUD Capital, Buffy leverages her experience in finance to adeptly navigate startup investment complexities, her experience in healthcare to advance healthcare for all and strategically guide portfolio companies through complex business models, and her experience in venture investing to lead initiatives that reshape the venture capital model. Buffyâs comprehensive work on healthcare system boards, coupled with her educational background in science and medicine, shapes her strategic thinking and decision-making. This combination of financial acumen and healthcare insight positions her to effectively drive LOUD Capital's mission of building massive value for investors, portfolio companies, and the communities we live in.
tag_to_content.p_14: At LOUD Capital, Darshan provides the vision, tactical organization, and execution behind LOUDâs growth trajectory by identifying key initiatives, projects, and deals that help stimulate LOUDâs growth and expansion. His chief skill sets lie in identifying the core problem and aggregating the proper resources to solve it. Â Prior to co-founding LOUD Capital, Darshan operated a Healthcare Technology firm providing back office and infrastructure support to small and medium-sized hospitals, which successfully exited via acquisition. Darshan took his experience as an entrepreneur and applied it to the ecosystem by investing in and mentoring talented entrepreneurs who needed guidance and strategy. This passion ultimately evolved into the formation of LOUD Capital.
tag_to_content.div_19: Managing Partner & Lead Partner of LoudX Consultancy
tag_to_content.div_20: Managing Partner & Lead Partner of LoudX Consultancy
tag_to_content.p_16: At LOUD Capital, Ryan leverages his twenty years of experience of financing, advising, angel and venture investing, and building early-to-growth stage businesses as a Managing Partner and Lead Strategist. He has been a CFO, COO, and Managing Partner at multiple VC firms and early-stage companies. He has built due diligence, investor relations, portfolio relations, corporate finance, and operations platforms for multiple venture capital firms while advising and consulting dozens of early-stage companies, non-profit, and social enterprises on operations and growth strategies. Most recently, Ryan has leveraged decades of passion and experience as a strategist and certifications as a Futurist, in Design Thinking, and Workshop Facilitation around strategy to build and co-lead LOUD Capitalâs growth and strategy consultancy, LoudX.Â  There, he acts as a lead workshop designer and facilitator for clients of high-growth ventures helping them solve problems, make decisions, and take action.
tag_to_content.p_18: At LOUD Capital, Brian leverages his experience as an exited entrepreneur and angel investor to help make LOUD a truly futurist VC through a technology-focused and data-driven approach. Brian has been successful in building and scaling companies from concept to exit and offers support to LOUDâs portfolio companies around growth, marketing, and business development, in addition to innovating new ways for LOUD to source qualified dealflow, attract LPs, and gain market visibility. Brian is a recognized author, speaker, and former professional musician, and he brings a unique perspective to LOUD, which further diversifies our leadership to create an impact in VC.
tag_to_content.p_20: At LOUD Capital, Jenny leverages her experience in early-stage life science and health-tech innovation as a strategist, angel investor, and advisory board member, as well as operational expertise as a physician and life scientist. She has experience developing and implementing both consumer-facing and enterprise-facing digital health tools, as well as serving in management and executive roles at community health clinics and life science accelerators. Having further studied Management of Technology and Innovation, Health System Strategy and Operations, and VC finance, she brings a rigorous approach to investing in and driving operational excellence for portfolio companies.
tag_to_content.div_28: Principal at LOUD Capital, Director of Operations
tag_to_content.div_29: Principal at LOUD Capital, Director of Operations
tag_to_content.p_22: At LOUD Capital, Blake leverages his consulting and business development experience, working in organizations ranging from seed-stage startups to the Fortune 250, where he focused on Human Capital Management (HCM), Operations and Growth strategies for startups, small businesses and middle-market companies. Blakeâs expertise in these areas, combined with his âpeople-centricâ approach, brings a unique perspective to LOUD, where he has done everything from raising/deploying capital, consulting portfolio companies and conducting diligence, to managing investor relations and running both firm and fund operations. Most recently, Blake became a Managing Partner for LoudX, the strategic services arm of LOUD Capital, while still raising and deploying capital and managing operations for the firm and various funds.
tag_to_content.p_24: Marshall utilizes his diverse, educational and professional background as a surgeon, where he has spent over two decades caring for other people, trying to help, improve, and fix their problems, and learning how to think and improvise towards solutions as a springboard to a successful career in business, investing, and venture capital with LOUD Capital. He is an experienced fundraiser, Entrepreneur, and Team Builder who prides himself on being relatable to a wide variety of individuals, whether they are inexperienced or veteran investors, founders, or physicians at various stages of their careers. At LOUD Capital, Marshall is a general partner with years of experience, helping to manage alternative investments and fundraising.
tag_to_content.h4_0: Strategic Advisors for Catalyst Health Fund
tag_to_content.p_25: Connie Collingsworth is an experienced board member with expertise in governance, risk management, executive compensation and complex investments for publicly traded companies, private companies, and private equity funds. Her board experience includes leadership positions as Board Chair, Compensation Committee Chair, and Nominating and Governance Committee Chair, as well as serving as a member of Audit, Risk, and Investment Committees on both public and private company boards as well as a number of nonprofit corporations. Â
tag_to_content.p_26: Connieâs current board roles include Banner Corporation, a publicly traded bank holding company with $16.8B in assets, operating 130 branches throughout U.S. West Coast, where she Chairs the Governance & Nominating Committee, and Axxes Capital, a private market platform supporting accredited investors to democratize private equity through expanding access to a range of private equity assets.Â She also serves as a Board Advisor to Planet First Partners, a $500M European private equity fund based in London focused on investments aligned with UN Sustainable Development Goals and Europeâs Green Deal, and as a Strategic Advisor to LoudCapital, a venture fund focused on fueling innovations that drive equitable access to high-quality, people-centered healthcare, including MedTech, Alternative Care Models, Healthcare Infrastructure and IT.
tag_to_content.p_27: Connie is the former COO of the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, the largest foundation in the world with approximately $60B in assets, distributing over $8.3B annually. During her 22-year tenure she was responsible for managing and scaling the foundationâs business operations throughout the world, including in India, China, Africa, and Europe. She also held the title of Chief Legal Officer, which involved advising trustees, Bill Gates, Melinda French Gates, and Warren Buffett, on governance, including creating the foundationâs new Governing Board. She was the architect of the foundationâs philosophy known as âGlobal Access,â and led the foundationâs work in collaborating with for-profit companies, including big pharma and the biotech and ed-tech sectors. Â
tag_to_content.p_28: Connie currently is a board member and audit committee member of the National Philanthropic Trust, the largest nonprofit administrator of donor advised funds, with $30B of assets under management. She serves an Executive Sponsor of the Bank of America Enterprise Executive Development Program for high potential leaders, and is an adjunct professor at the University of Washington School of Foster School of Business teaching the class âCEO and Board Leadership; an Insidersâ View of Corporate Governance.â
tag_to_content.p_29: Connie holds an LL.M. in International Business Studies from the University of Exeter, England, a J.D. from the University of Nebraska, and a B.A. from Andrews University.
tag_to_content.p_30: Etoy Ridgnal is a respected Social Impact Strategist, Advisor, and Investor with a 30-year history of developing, advising on, and leading large-scale social impact initiatives for some of the nationâs largest companies, organizations, influencers, and leaders.
tag_to_content.p_31: Through her social impact firm, Community Advocacy Partners (CAP), she has developed and led cause marketing campaigns for mission-driven film/tv projects like âCONCUSSIONâ starring Will Smith (Sony Pictures), Oprah Winfreyâs âBELIEFâ Series (OWN), Ava DuVernayâs âSELMAâ (Paramount) and âHalf the Pictureâ featuring Ava DuVernay.
tag_to_content.p_32: Throughout the course of her 30-year career, Etoy has also led civic engagement and advocacy campaigns for a diverse range of global organizations. She has advised and led social impact initiatives for key public figures such as Will Smith, Oprah Winfrey, the Obama White House, and Mike Bloomberg.
tag_to_content.p_33: She currently serves as an Advisory Board Member for JUST Capital, Amalgamated Bank Foundation, and LOUD Capital. She has helped raise over $600 million for charitable causes and secured press coverage for clients across the globe in outlets such as The Hollywood Reporter, Variety, The Guardian, The Los Angeles Times, The Chicago Tribune, Hypebeast, Business Insider and HuffPost to name a few.
tag_to_content.p_34: A graduate of Scripps College of the Claremont Colleges with a Bachelorâs degree in Psychology and African-American Studies. Etoy is a student of life and an avid believer in the power of the collective to create the world we want to live in.
tag_to_content.p_35: She divides her time between Laguna Beach, New York City, and London.
tag_to_content.p_36: Sailesh has over 30 years of experience during which he has created multiple billions of dollars in value and has had a global impact in health care, consumer and enterprise software/hardware, telecommunications, and media in the Fortune 500 companies as well as startups. He has done this by making strategic investments, building successful businesses, executing turnarounds, and creating new products, platforms, and services. Â
tag_to_content.p_37: Most recently Sailesh was the CTO of Logitech reporting to the CEO. He helped the company grow from $3B to over $5B in revenue, through digital transformation; development of new businesses, products, and capabilities; M&A; and investments in promising startups. Prior to that he had executive roles at Amazon and Microsoft and was the CEO of a pioneering digital health company Mobisante.
tag_to_content.p_38: At Amazon, as an EIR, Sailesh developed opportunities in consumer robotics and sustainability. As the CEO of Mobisante, he led the company through initial product creation, FDA clearance,financing, GTM, revenues, and sale to private equity. He managed a $220M+ P&L at Microsoft after turning it around, and a $100M investment portfolio focused on early-stage technologies.Sailesh was in the initial team of Transarc (acquired by IBM) that became a multi-billion-dollarbusiness.
tag_to_content.p_39: He currently serves on the boards and advisory of companies and not-for-profit organizations focused on increasing affordability and accessibility of healthcare, aging, decarbonizing, and sustainability.
tag_to_content.p_40: Dr Amit Rana bringsÂ 25 years of blended global experience in clinical, innovation, technology, and healthcare business management.Â He had the privilege to work in each segment of the healthcare ecosystem: as a Trauma critical care surgeon with fellowships in Neuro-Trauma and Vascular surgery, asÂ a serial entrepreneur on both sides of healthcare (digital and hospital centres), board advisor in multiple health tech groups, as an operator of level 1 trauma centres, as an innovator start-up mentor in innovation hubs, and also as an expert volunteer to upgrade emergency systems in various inaccessible remote regions of the world.
tag_to_content.p_41: He has on-ground global experience from both public and corporate health systems in four continents: North America, Australia, Europe, and Asia. He helped to steer a $150 Million hospital chain venture with successful partnerships with multi-billion value healthcare groups, technology giants and government stakeholders.
tag_to_content.p_42: As a trauma team leader, he led teams of doctors, nurses, and paramedics to provide timely care to most critically injured patients. He has published research and chaired sessions at world trauma congresses. He has set up and fully operationalized level 1 trauma referral centres from bare-shell building stage, including for a fifty one hospitals health system chain. He has led a cross functional teams to transform a thirty-year-old tertiary care hospital unit with digital transformation, operational efficiency and culture change.
tag_to_content.p_43: He founded a multi-sided cancer care digital platform and a social impact platform in preventive health for the under-privileged youth. He is on boards of innovative ventures: maternal-tech venture (NYC), data security technology group (Europe), life sciences ventures (Boston) and others.
tag_to_content.p_44: He is an alum of Columbia BusinessSchool and prestigious Senior Executive fellows of Harvard Kennedy School ofGovernment as well a gold medallist in MD Medicine (Delhi). He is an invited thought leader, speaker, expert panelist, mentor faculty at health innovation conferences including at healthcare hackathons at MIT.
tag_to_content.p_45: He is volunteering in a committee of Harvard alumni for Climate Change and as a mentor to senior executive fellows of John F. Kennedy school. His recent talks on âdigital health leadershipâ (Columbia University), Future of Healthcare (Harvard) and Role of extended reality in surgery, NYC, were well received. He supports tech-based care and has trained in Artificial intelligence and Robotics surgery.
tag_to_content.p_46: An avid traveller, enjoys meditation, chronic learner of history, new cultures and leadership as well as giving back to the community.
tag_to_content.p_47: Founded in 2015, LOUD started by investing in early-stage companies and has since grown to include several other investment offerings in the alternatives space.

tag_to_content.title: Terms of Use âÂ Loud Capital
tag_to_content.p_1: General. Thanks for your interest in our website at www.loud.vc (the âWebsiteâ).Your use of this Website, including the content, materials and information available on or through this Website (together, the "Materials"), is governed by these Terms of Use (these "Terms"). By using this Website, you acknowledge that you have read and agree to these Terms.
tag_to_content.p_2: Who We Are. This Website is maintained and operated by LOUD Capital, LLC.In accordance with industry custom, this Website occasionally uses terminology that may be interpreted to suggest that our firm is actually a single entity. However, there is no such single entity, and all of the entities that comprise our firm have their own separate legal existence.
tag_to_content.p_3: No Offer, Solicitation, or Advice. Nothing on this Website is intended to constitute (i) an offer, or solicitation of an offer, to purchaseor sell any security, other asset or service, (ii) investment advice or an offer to provide such advice, or (iii) a basis for making any investment decision. Neither this Website nor any of the Materials make any effort to present a comprehensive or balanced description of LOUD Capital, LLC, or its investment activities. Any portfolio company described on this Website may not be representative of all investments made by any LOUD Capital fund or other investment vehicle and is intended to be illustrative of the types of investments that may be made by such a LOUD Capital managed or affiliated fund or investment vehicle.
tag_to_content.p_4: Submitting a Business Plan or Other Confidential Information. Due to the large number of business plan ideas and related materials that we review, and the similarity of many such plans and materials, we cannot accept responsibility for protecting against misuse or disclosure of any confidential or proprietary information or other materials in the absence of our express written agreement to do so. Any plans, information, and other materials you submit in connection with this Website may be used or disclosed by us for any purpose and in any manner as we determine in our sole discretion. Please consider this carefully before sending us any information or other materials that you deem confidential or proprietary.

tag_to_content.p_6: Third-Party Sites. We accept no responsibility for third-party sites available through this Website, via hyperlink or otherwise.
